ratings.comment: Difficult but fair professor that cares a whole heck of a lot about what she's talking about and makes every lecture almost like a movie in your head that you can easily follow.

This is one of the best Professors that I have ever encountered. Her discusion on the age of Enlightenment has helped me not just understand a complex age in human history but she inspired me to really enjoy it.
Sadge

Professor Desan gives some of the most passionate, energetic lectures I've ever seen. She cares deeply about the topics she teaches and makes it impossible not to care just as much when she speaks on the topic. There is a lot of reading to do for her courses, but the reading is always applicable and related to lecture content.

Desan is incredibly knowledgeable and enthusiastic, however the lectures are not needed(but attendance is mandatory). She hands out a "textbook" with all the readings you will need, and those are the basis for your papers. Everything is graded harshly and her expectations are through the roof. If you don't like writing, don't take the class.

Desan is so smart and I learned so much in this class. However, it completely ruined my mental health because she expected so much and was honestly mean to me many times. I felt worthless because my best work was absolutely never enough for her.

Professor Desan is very knowledgeable about French and European history in general, but her class is very, very difficult. Attendance at lectures is required and papers are graded harshly. Biggest suggestions would be to attend her office hours and to ask plenty of questions. If you work hard, though, you will pass.

Professor Desan was great! Her recorded lectures are always super clear and sometimes very funny/quirky. Her in-person lectures were a bit of a mixed bag, really depended on how much the class was willing to participate. (Not her fault at all!) She's also very good at spacing out assignments. I would highly recommend her classes!!!!!

It's very difficult to get an A. The TA barely gives out any grades higher than a 94. You absolutely have to work for it. Prof Desan is a really good professor; her lectures are funny and engaging and some materials are drawn from her own research. There are three exams and two papers. It's good for what it is as an intro-level history course.

Good class if you are interested in learning a general overview of European history. Professor Desan is really passionate about the class and always makes sure to include funny jokes and stories throughout. The class is pretty lecture, reading, and writing heavy, but it is fairly manageable. Not the easiest class, but was very enjoyable.

I have never written one of these but this class forced me to. This was the worst class I have ever taken. Her lectures made no sense, she was mean to students, mandatory participation IN LECTURE, she curved the class extremely difficult and we had about 1 million essays. I worked my butt of for my grade. Absolutely ridiculous class. Terrible.

Suzanne Desan is one of the most engaging lecturers I've ever heard. As an absolutely brilliant subject matter expert on the world of the Revolution, she capably weaves the grand narratives of economic forces and class conflict with intimate looks at the prime movers and precipitating moments. In effect, she makes you feel that you've lived it.

She is incredibly passionate about her field of study and it shows.  Her lectures are very captivating and her sense of humor makes the power lectures fly by.  She's the first professor I would specifically seek out when taking future courses, couldn't recommend more.

Had to miss a couple classes due to family issues towards the beginning of class. She made sure to make me feel bad for not being there and was very rude to other students who were not always there. I know it's necessary to go to class, but it's not necessary to be that mean to students who don't.

I have never had a more rude teacher. She calls people out for doing nothing wrong, is mean to people who aren't in class, and is just inconsiderate of others overall. Desan didn't grade papers and the grad students that did were overly critical and she wouldn't change anyone's grades despite agreeing that the grad students were too harsh.

She was absolutely wonderful. She was so enthusiastic about everything she taught, it just made you excited about the material. She always encouraged questions and was easy to talk to. When you get to class, you have to be prepared to write, and write fast, but she's very clear in what she says and what you'll be going over for the day.

She is a great lecturer, and knows what she is talking about.  She goes in depth about each subject, making the class insightful and entertaining.  The tests are long, tough, and very specific.  But if you attend the lectures and discussion, and you actually pay attention, you can do well in the class.  There are 7 books that are required reads.

Prof Desan is awesome: she is super enthusiastic about what she teaches, and she frequently uses information from her own researches. Very interesting lectures, though tests and papers are not so easily graded.

Professor Desan was awesome! She  is very excited about the subject and that shows in class.  She has a good sense of humor and genuinely wants you to understand the story behind the French Revolution. I would definitely take a class with her again.

Absolutely love her. Awesome lecturer, high energy and she loves what she teaches. She makes you interested in what she teaches. Take good notes, she helps out with an outline on the board. TA grades exams and papers, but everything she lectures about is helpful in preparation for exam.
It's always easy to pay attention to her lectures because she is so excited about the material. Tests were hard but not impossible. Very enjoyable class.

My favorite professor so far at UW, will definitely be taking her classes in the future. She is always excited and loves the subject, so I always WANTED to attend lecture. Attendance isn't graded but it's important, as are the readings. Tests are a bit hard. But I learned so much in her class, and loved every minute.

She was wonderful, never have I seen a professor so excited about their subject. I was terrified about the 2.5 hour lecture but it became my favorite part of the week. She taught with such enthusiasm and great stories, it was easy to stay attentive during lectures. I wish I had time to take more classes with her!

I LOVE Prof. Desan. I had her for a 2.5 hour power lecture and yet she held my attention until the last second. She loves history and gets the class to enjoy it to! She is hilarious and always helpful, always running around the ront of the class and energetic. Her enthusiasm is contagious. Love Desan and plan on taking more classes with her!

I LOVE Prof Desan. Had her for a 2.5 hr power lecture and kept my attention right up tot he last minute. Cannot speak highly enough of her and I'm not even interested in Early Modern Europe. TA Katie was great. Pretty easy 100 level course. I wish I had taken a class with her before my last semester so I could have taken more with Desan!

AMAZING lecturer, I have taken 2 classes with her and they are my favorites from college. Her lectures give the historical facts but in an entertaining manner and the readings relate perfectly to course material. She is a must take if you like French history especially, she is incredibly knowledgeable
Obviously loves what she is teaching and is a great professor. Attendance isn't necessary but definitely worth it!

Fantastic professor! I plan to take more classes with Professor Desan. Her lectures are clear, the readings always relate and are always interesting. Desan keeps the class moving and is very energetic. Excellent sense of humor. Very knowledgeable. Approachable. Reasonable expectations. Great topic. Lectures keep everyone engaged.
Interesting and enthusiastic lectures, but really difficult grading scale. If you want higher than a B be prepared to put a TON of work in.
Not a good class if you enough actual HISTORY and not just random facts that are meaningless  when put together. Avoid her class if possible.

A great professor, so enthusiastic... I learned a lot lot lot, and would definitely take another class from her. However, she is definitely not easy, you have to work for your grade, and be prepared to write a lot. (I was doing very well, until a bad grade on a paper killed my grade.) Fair but hard grader, I would definitely recommend her.

SO. energetic. Could keep me interested and amused for an entire power lecture even when i was dead tired.Definitely a writing based class-tests are three essays and then some written identifications, and then a papers. But as long as you took some notes during lecture thats all information you need. dont bother getting the book if you dont want it
Highly energetic prof.  Very enthusiastic about the material, especially French Rev.  Very informative and helpful.  Office hours are a must and will improve papers greatly.
great!

Desan is a high-energy,  enthusiastic professor, however her lectures could be better organized.  Do take her class excepting an easy A.  Her grading is strict, but fair.  Off topic note: she stutters frequently, which can be at times humorous.
Great Class, I learned alot. Very interesting lectures. I am not a great writer so I did not do well on her essay tests which is unfortunate.

Can talk very fast but gives you all you need for the exam. The tests are straightforward. As long as you get down what she is saying, often very quickly, you will be fine. Note: She does write outlines down on the board for her lectures so you can anticipate some of the stuff she will say.

Very stict grading! It's really tough to pull off a good grade in this class, unless you're an awesome writter expect B's and C's. Grading is based on 2 essays, 3 tests (made up of essays). This is more of a writting class than history.
good lecturer but can stutter at times. i do like her though

she is a brilliant lecturer, really engaging even in the last 5 minutes of a power lecture. sometimes she talks a little fast and its hard to copy notes as fast as she's talking, but shes funny and engaging. her grading kicked my ass tho, the tests are straightforward but take FOREVER.

I've never really felt like a professor outright disliked me until taking this class.  Totally agree w/ the remarks about dealing w/ her one-on-one (unless you're one of her favorites).   Despite that, I enjoyed the class & the lectures were interesting.  The grader was really fair & I managed to do well.
she's a passionate teacher, but can be really mean when you go one on one with her.  she's a hard grader who expects a lot more then you should have to give for the class
Incredible Lecturer..passionate about France, and the Revolution...I would take another history class from her in a heartbeat.
She is awesome! She is so excited and hilarious and keeps my attention for the whole power lecture. I love her.
Truly loves what she teaches and this enthusiasm is spread to the class. Very funny.  You have to work in the class, but it is well worth it.
wonderful lectures and she REALLY knows her stuff.
